metadata.Title: CVE-2015-4491 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Integer overflow in the make_filter_table function in pixops/pixops.c in gdk-pixbuf before 2.31.5, as used in Mozilla Firefox before 40.0 and Firefox ESR 38.x before 38.2 on Linux, Google Chrome on Linux, and other products, allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service (heap-based buffer overflow and application crash) via crafted bitmap dimensions that are mishandled during scaling.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-4491` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 40.0+build4-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 40.0+build4-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 40.0+build4-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 40.0+build4-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

gir1.2-gdkpixbuf-2.0 - 2.30.7-0ubuntu1.1
libgdk-pixbuf2.0-0 - 2.30.7-0ubuntu1.1
libgdk-pixbuf2.0-common - 2.30.7-0ubuntu1.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:38.2.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-globalmenu - 1:38.2.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:38.2.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:38.2.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-testsuite - 1:38.2.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:38.2.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:38.2.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:38.2.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required
